tickerNews.title: INDF: Net Profit Driven by Currency Gains, Operations Still Solid
tickerNews.content:
Indofood Sukses Makmur (INDF) recorded a strong net profit of IDR 4.9 trillion (+224% YoY, +249% QoQ) in Q3 2024. This result lifted 9-month net profit to IDR 8.8 trillion (+24% YoY), surpassing expectations at 90%/94% of the Stockbit/Fox consensus for FY24. The strong Q3 net profit was driven by a currency gain of IDR 3.4 trillion as the rupiah appreciated against the US dollar from IDR 16,421 at the end of June 2024 to IDR 15,138 at the end of September 2024. The currency gain reversed the situation from the previous quarter, when INDF’s Q2 2024 net profit was hit by a currency loss.

Operationally, operating profit grew in Q3 2024 to IDR 5.3 trillion (+8% YoY, +3% QoQ). This made 9-month operating profit IDR 16.3 trillion (+15% YoY), beating the estimate at 83%/73% of the Stockbit/Fox FY24 consensus, above the historical range of about 72%. The operating profit growth was driven by revenue growth and maintained profitability.

- Revenue grew, driven by the ICBP and agribusiness segments. INDF revenue rose to IDR 29.6 trillion (+7% YoY, +12% QoQ) in Q3 2024, taking 9-month revenue to IDR 87 trillion (74%/75% of the FY24 consensus). The revenue increase was mainly from the consumer branded products segment under the main subsidiary Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur (ICBP), which posted IDR 18.8 trillion (+11% YoY, +9% QoQ) in Q3 2024 and IDR 55.6 trillion (+8% YoY) for the 9-month period. The agribusiness segment also posted solid quarterly revenue growth of +28% QoQ.

- Profitability remained solid, supported by the agribusiness segment. INDF’s operating margin rose +27 basis points YoY to 17.7% in Q3 2024, despite a -149-basis-point QoQ decline, still above our estimate of 16.8% for FY24. By segment, the operating margin was supported by agribusiness, which posted an almost 2-fold increase to 22.4%/16.8% in Q3 2024/9M 2024. The strong agribusiness margin offset weaker margins in three other segments, each of which saw operating-margin declines. We estimate the agribusiness margin strength was due to a CPO price increase of about +6% in Q3 2024, while the ICBP margin weakness is estimated to be caused by a wheat price increase of about +6% in Q3 2024.

Key Takeaway: In the previous quarter we noted that INDF’s 2H 2024 outlook could improve as the rupiah recovered against the US dollar, which is now reflected in Q3 2024 performance. Two main risks/opportunities for Q4 2024: (1) a weakening rupiah could generate a currency loss again – the rupiah is currently at 15,700 per US$ (about –4% versus the end of Q3 2024); (2) wheat and CPO prices that remain favorable could help sustain a higher FY24 margin – wheat in October 2024 stayed below US$6 per bushel (our assumption 6.20) supporting ICBP margin, while agribusiness margin could rise as CPO prices have risen about +15% in the last month to RM 4,700 per ton (our assumption RM 3,700).

tickerNews.title: ADRO 9M24: Net Profit Down 3% YoY, Better Than Expectations
tickerNews.content: Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO) reported a net profit of US$404 million (+17.1% YoY, –0.1% QoQ) in Q3 2024. This resulted in a 9-month net profit of US$1.2 billion (-3% YoY), beating expectations at 82%/96% of the FY24 Stockbit/consensus estimate. ADRO’s revenue fell 3.3% QoQ in Q3 2024 and –10.6% YoY over 9M 2024, well ahead of our forecast (-12.8% YoY) and the consensus (-19.3% YoY) for FY24. The result was supported by higher sales volume while Indonesian coal (ICI) prices were flat in Q3 2024. Gross margin was 37.1% in Q3 2024 (vs. 37.9% in Q2 2024) and 39.5% over 9M 2024 (vs. 39.9% in 9M 2023), also better than our FY24 estimate of 38.4%. Cash cost for ADRO in 9M 2024 remained below our estimate at US$48.5 per ton, although a quarterly increase is possible.

tickerNews.title: ANTM: Net Profit Decline Amid Currency Loss
tickerNews.content: Aneka Tambang (ANTM) posted a net profit of IDR 650 billion (-50.4% QoQ, -32.1% YoY) in Q3 2024. This made 9-month net profit IDR 2.2 trillion (-22.7% YoY), better than expectations at 88% of the FY24 consensus estimate. The Q3 2024 profit decline was driven by a currency loss of IDR 428 billion (vs. a profit of IDR 327 billion in Q2 2024). Operationally, ANTM produced 5.08 tonnes of ferronickel (-5.7% QoQ, -3.3% YoY) in Q3 2024, nickel ore production of 3.1 million wmt (+13.7% QoQ, -16.6% YoY), and gold production of 9,774 troy oz (+11.4% QoQ, -3.5% YoY).

tickerNews.title: MAPA: Net Profit Rises 40% YoY in Q3 2024
tickerNews.content: MAP Aktif Adiperkasa (MAPA) posted a net profit of IDR 515 billion (+40% YoY, +68% QoQ) in Q3 2024. This lifted 9-month net profit to IDR 1.1 trillion (+8% YoY), surpassing expectations at 79% of the FY24 consensus (seasonality 2022-2023 9M net profit was 69-73%). The Q3 2024 profit increase was driven by: 1) accelerated revenue growth (+25% YoY, +8% QoQ); 2) higher operating-profit margin (-96 bps YoY, +230 bps QoQ) from efficiency and operating leverage; and 3) other income from a currency gain of IDR 59 billion (vs. a loss of IDR 5 billion in Q3 2023 and a loss of IDR 35 billion in Q2 2024).

tickerNews.title: MAPI: 9M24 Net Profit Down 8% YoY
tickerNews.content: Mitra Adiperkasa (MAPI) posted a net profit of IDR 401 billion (0% YoY, -17% QoQ) in Q3 2024. This resulted in a 9-month net profit of IDR 1.3 trillion (-8% YoY), below expectations at 68% of the FY24 consensus (seasonality 9M 2022-9M 2023: 74-75%). Revenue in Q3 2024 grew to IDR 9.6 trillion (+17% YoY, +5% QoQ), taking 9-month revenue to IDR 27.6 trillion (+16% YoY). The profit dip was caused by a weaker operating-profit margin of 8% (-213 bps YoY, -179 bps QoQ), mainly due to losses in the Café & Restaurant segment and a decline in the Fashion & Digital segment.

tickerNews.title: INKP: Q3 2024 Net Loss of US$53 million
tickerNews.content: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper (INKP) recorded a net loss of US$53 million in Q3 2024 (vs. a net profit of US$148 million in Q2 2024 and US$52 million in Q3 2023), marking its first loss since Q2 2011. This made 9-month net loss IDR 226 million (-30% YoY). The Q3 loss was driven by a currency loss of US$157 million (vs. a profit of US$50 million in Q2 2024 and US$33 million in Q3 2023). Operating profit was US$162 million in Q3 2024 (-12% QoQ, +43% YoY). The quarterly operating profit decline was mainly due to (1) lower pulp selling prices and (2) higher opex.

tickerNews.title: TKIM: Q3 2024 Net Loss of US$113 million
tickerNews.content: Pabrik Kertas Tjiwi Kimia (TKIM) posted a net loss of US$113 million (-30% YoY) in Q3 2024 (vs. a net profit of US$111 million in Q2 2024 and US$70 million in Q3 2023), its first loss since Q4 2020. This resulted in a 9-month net loss of US$103 million (-23% YoY). The loss was driven by a currency loss of US$53 million (Q2 2024: profit US$19 million, Q3 2023: profit US$21 million). Additionally, the joint-venture TKIM (OKI Pulp) posted a loss of US$52 million (vs. a profit of US$81 million in Q2 2024 and US$48 million in Q3 2023). The OKI Pulp loss was likely caused by a currency loss, as OKI Pulp recorded a currency gain of US$148 million in H1 2024.

tickerNews.title: INCO: Q3 2024 Net Profit Falls 77% YoY
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia (INCO) posted a net profit of US$17 million (-77% YoY, -44% QoQ) in Q3 2024, bringing 9-month net profit to US$51 million (-78.6% YoY), below expectations at 63%/58% of the FY24 Stockbit/consensus estimate. The Q3 profit decline was mainly due to a 1.9% QoQ increase in cost of sales amid a 7.6% QoQ revenue decline as average selling price fell 8.9% QoQ, despite a 1.4% QoQ rise in sales volume. The higher cost of sales was driven by a 9.3% QoQ increase in fuel and lubricant costs, mainly from higher high-sulphur fuel oil (HSFO) consumption of 21.9 bbl/ton (-2.6% QoQ) and a 5.5% QoQ rise in HSFO ASP.

tickerNews.title: HRUM: Q3 2024 Net Profit Down 10.5% YoY
tickerNews.content: Harum Energy (HRUM) posted a net profit of US$32.6 million (-10.5% YoY) in Q3 2024, reversing a loss of US$43.3 million in Q3 2023. The 9-month net profit was US$69.9 million (-34.8% YoY), equal to 56% of the FY24 consensus. The Q3 profit dip was caused by a 17.6% QoQ increase in cost of sales and a 19.2% QoQ rise in opex, outpacing revenue growth of 12.9% QoQ, pulling the operating margin down to 14.4% (Q2 2024: 17.9%).

tickerNews.title: AMRT: Q3 2024 Net Profit Up 5% YoY
tickerNews.content: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (AMRT) posted a net profit of IDR 604 billion (+5% YoY, -33% QoQ) in Q3 2024. This made 9-month net profit IDR 2.4 trillion (+10% YoY), in line with expectations at 59% of the FY24 consensus (seasonality 9M21-9M23: 57-64%). Revenue grew to IDR 29 trillion (+11% YoY, -3% QoQ), taking 9-month revenue to IDR 88.2 trillion (+10% YoY) and matching the 74% FY24 consensus (seasonality 9M21-9M23: 74-75%). The revenue increase was broad-based, led by a 16% YoY growth outside Java. Operating margin fell to 2.7% in Q3 2024 (vs. 2.9% in Q3 2023, 3.9% in Q2 2024). The margin decline was due to other income falling to IDR 287 billion (vs. IDR 337 billion in Q3 2023).

tickerNews.title: MIDI: Q3 2024 Net Profit Up 8% YoY
tickerNews.content: Midi Utama Indonesia (MIDI) posted a net profit of IDR 142 billion (+8% YoY, -14% QoQ) in Q3 2024. This resulted in a 9-month net profit of IDR 467 billion (+20% YoY), in line with expectations at 75% of the FY24 consensus (seasonality 9M22-9M23: 76-77%). Revenue grew to IDR 4.9 trillion (+15% YoY, -2% QoQ), taking 9-month revenue to IDR 27.6 trillion (+14% YoY). Same-store sales grew 11.07% YoY in Q3 2024 (vs. 9.64% YoY in H1 2024). Revenue grew double-digit across all regions: outside Java +23% YoY, Jakarta-Bogor-Tangerang-Bekasi +17% YoY, and Java outside J-B +10% YoY. Operating margin slipped to 3.8% (-47 bps YoY, -57 bps QoQ) in Q3 2024 and 4.1% (-28 bps YoY) over 9M 2024, pressured by a decline in other income to IDR 55 billion in Q3 2024 (vs. IDR 93 billion in Q3 2023).

tickerNews.title: BREN: Q3 2024 Net Profit Up 5% YoY
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) posted a net profit of US$28 million (+5% YoY, -3% QoQ) in Q3 2024, resulting in a 9-month net profit of US$86 million (+2% YoY). Operating profit rose 1% YoY and 5% QoQ in Q3 2024, supported by a 5% YoY, 2% QoQ revenue increase from the newly acquired PLTB Sidrap.

tickerNews.title: CTRA: Q3 2024 Net Profit Down 38% YoY
tickerNews.content: Ciputra Development (CTRA) posted a net profit of IDR 248 billion (-38% YoY, -55% QoQ) in Q3 2024. This made 9-month net profit IDR 1.3 trillion (+8% YoY), equal to 61% of the FY24 consensus. Operating profit fell (-30% YoY, -42% QoQ) due to a 2% YoY, -24% QoQ revenue decline and a 12% YoY, 10% QoQ rise in opex, resulting in a 140 bps YoY operating-margin decline.

tickerNews.title: BSDE: Q3 2024 Net Profit Down 35% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE) posted a net profit of IDR 369 billion (-35% YoY, -59% QoQ) in Q3 2024, bringing 9-month net profit to IDR 2.7 trillion (+53% YoY), in line with expectations at 74% of the FY24 consensus. Operating profit fell (-4% YoY, -50% QoQ) in Q3 2024 due to low commercial-seasonality, while revenue fell 17% YoY, -24% QoQ, insufficient to offset higher opex. Nevertheless, 9-month operating profit reached IDR 3.6 trillion (+58% YoY) thanks to strong revenue-recognition growth (+38% YoY) and operating-margin expansion (+450 bps YoY).

tickerNews.title: KLBF: Q3 2024 Net Profit Up 7% YoY
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma (KLBF) posted a net profit of IDR 573 billion (+7% YoY, -32% QoQ) in Q3 2024. This made 9-month net profit IDR 2.3 trillion (+15% YoY), matching 73% of the FY24 consensus (vs. 9M23: 75% of FY23 net profit). The 9-month profit was at the top of management’s FY24 guidance range of +13-15%. The modest annual profit growth was mainly due to higher operating expenses (≈28% of revenue, up from 27% in Q3 2023) while gross margin rose to 39% (up from 37% in Q3 2023 and 39% in Q2 2024). Operating profit was IDR 677 billion (+3% YoY, -35% QoQ) in Q3 2024.

tickerNews.title: TOWR: Q3 2024 Net Profit Down 12% YoY
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara (TOWR) posted a net profit of IDR 842 billion (-12% YoY, +4% QoQ) in Q3 2024. This resulted in a 9-month net profit of IDR 2.4 trillion (+1% YoY), below expectations at 70% of the FY24 consensus. The Q3 loss was pressured by a currency loss of IDR 82 billion in other operating expenses (vs. a gain of IDR 7 billion in Q3 2023 and a loss of IDR 41 billion in Q2 2024) and higher other expenses of IDR 141 billion (vs. IDR 61 billion in 2023, IDR 26 billion in Q2 2024). Operating profit rose to IDR 2 trillion (+4% YoY, +8% QoQ) in Q3 2024, taking 9-month operating profit to IDR 5.7 trillion (+4% YoY), surpassing the 76% FY24 consensus. The growth was likely driven by the addition of Inti Bangun Sejahtera (IBST) acquired in Q2 2024.

tickerNews.title: MPMX: Q3 2024 Net Profit Down 28% YoY
tickerNews.content: Mitra Pinasthika Mustika (MPMX) posted a net profit of IDR 114 billion (-28% YoY, -30% QoQ) in Q3 2024, resulting in a 9-month net profit of IDR 441 billion (+5% YoY), slightly below our estimate at 74% of the FY24 Stockbit consensus (vs. 9M23 net profit 80% of FY23). Revenue grew 22% YoY, 9% QoQ in Q3 2024, while the net-profit dip was driven by a currency loss of IDR 30 billion and a JV loss of IDR 21 billion.

tickerNews.title: ASRI: Q3 2024 Net Loss of IDR 6 billion
tickerNews.content: Alam Sutera Realty (ASRI) posted a net loss of IDR 6 billion in Q3 2024 (vs. a profit of IDR 43 billion in Q3 2023 and a loss of IDR 23 billion in Q2 2024), pressured by a 28% YoY, 31% QoQ drop in revenue recognition and a 1% YoY, 45% QoQ rise in financial costs. Over 9M 2024, ASRI’s net loss widened 90% YoY, driven by a currency loss and other items totalling IDR 198 billion (vs. 9M23 profit IDR 30 billion). Revenue grew only 2% YoY in 9M 2024 as operating expenses rose 5%, causing operating-margin decline.

tickerNews.title: POWR: Q3 2024 Net Profit Up 92% YoY
tickerNews.content: Cikarang Listrindo (POWR) posted a net profit of US$39 million (+92% YoY, +155% QoQ) in Q3 2024, resulting in a 9-month net profit of US$73 million (-5% YoY). The profit recovery was driven by a currency gain of US$4 million (vs. a loss of US$1 million in Q2 2024 and a loss of US$2 million in Q3 2023) and a reversal of a deferred tax charge of US$11.5 million (Q2 2024: US$5 million, Q3 2023: reversal of US$5 million). Operating profit fell (-3% YoY) but rose 21% QoQ in Q3 2024 due to a 23% YoY decline in electricity sales volume to PLN (181 GWh). The industrial segment saw a 3% YoY, 9% QoQ increase in electricity sales to 873 GWh in Q3 2024.

tickerNews.title: INDF: Net Profit Driven by Currency Gains, Operations Still Solid
tickerNews.content: Indofood Sukses Makmur (INDF) reported a net profit of IDR 4.9 trillion (+224% YoY, +249% QoQ) in Q3 2024, lifting 9-month net profit to IDR 8.8 trillion (+24% YoY), equal to 90%/94% of the FY24 Stockbit/consensus estimate. The Q3 profit was driven by a currency gain of IDR 3.4 trillion as the rupiah appreciated from IDR 16,421 per USD at end-June 2024 to IDR 15,138 per USD at end-September 2024, reversing the previous quarter’s currency loss. Operating profit grew to IDR 5.3 trillion (+8% YoY, +3% QoQ), making 9-month operating profit IDR 16.3 trillion (+15% YoY) and beating the 83%/73% FY24 consensus, above the historical 72% range. Revenue rose to IDR 29.6 trillion (+7% YoY, +12% QoQ) in Q3 2024, taking 9-month revenue to IDR 87 trillion (74%/75% of the FY24 consensus). Revenue growth was led by the consumer-branded-products segment under the subsidiary Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur (ICBP), which posted IDR 18.8 trillion (+11% YoY, +9% QoQ) in Q3 2024 and IDR 55.6 trillion (+8% YoY) for 9M 2024. The agribusiness segment also posted a solid +28% QoQ revenue increase in Q3 2024. Operating-margin rose 27 bps YoY to 17.7% in Q3 2024, despite a 149-bps QoQ decline, still above our 16.8% FY24 estimate. Segment-level, agribusiness margin rose to 22.4%/16.8% in Q3 2024/9M 2024, offsetting margin weakness in three other segments, which suffered margin declines partly due to a +6% wheat price increase in Q3 2024. The key takeaway notes that a weaker rupiah could reverse gains, while wheat and CPO price dynamics could support higher FY24 margins; wheat stayed below US$6 per bushel in October 2024 (our assumption US$6.20) and CPO rose about +15% to RM 4,700/ton (our assumption RM 3,700).
